verses.text: ，與他立約 神賜福給挪亞和他的兒子，對他們說：「你們要繁衍增多，充滿大地。

words.note: Specifically refers to a formal agreement or treaty, often divine.
A phrase common in biblical commands for procreation.

verses.text: 地上各樣的走獸，空中各樣的飛鳥，甚至地上各樣爬行的動物，和海裡各樣的魚類，都要對你們驚恐懼怕；這一切都已經交在你們手裡了。

words.note: Often used in biblical texts for wild land animals.
A strong compound expressing intense fear or dread.

verses.text: 所有活著的動物都可以作你們的食物，我把這一切都賜給你們，好像我把青菜賜給了你們一樣。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.

verses.text: 唯獨帶著生命的肉，就是帶著血的肉，你們卻不可吃。

words.note: A strong prohibition or negative imperative.

verses.text: 流你們的血、害你們生命的，我必向他們追償；無論是走獸或人類，甚至各人自己的兄弟，我必要他償命。

words.note: Here functions as a nominalizer, meaning 'those who...'
Implies a pursuit of justice or compensation.
Refers to land animals, often wild or untamed.
To give one's life as repayment for taking another's life.

verses.text: 流人血的，人也必流他的血；因為 神造人，是按著他自己的形象。

words.note: Refers to the act of killing a human.
Indicates certainty or inevitability.
The empty space often precedes 神 in Chinese Bibles to show reverence.

verses.text: 你們要繁衍增多；要在地上滋生、增多。」

words.note: A common biblical command (Gen 1:28, 9:7).
Often used in biological/natural contexts for reproduction.

verses.text: 神告訴挪亞和與他在一起的兒子說：
「看哪，我現在與你們和你們的後裔立約，

words.note: Used to draw attention, similar to 'lo' or 'behold'.
A key theological term for divine agreements in the Bible.

verses.text: 並且與所有跟你們在一起有生命的活物立約，包括飛鳥、牲畜和所有地上的走獸，就是與從方舟裡出來的立約。

words.note: Refers to land animals, often distinct from livestock.

verses.text: 我要與你們立約：凡有生命的必不再被洪水除滅，再沒有洪水來毀滅大地了。」

words.note: A more formal equivalent of 和 (hé) or 跟 (gēn).
A foundational biblical concept of agreement.
Often used in formal or biblical contexts to mean 'whatever' or 'all who'.
Emphasizes certainty or inevitability.

verses.text: 神說：「這就是我與你們，與一切跟你們同在有生命的活物所立之約的記號，直到萬代；

words.note: Refers to the singular God in the Christian Bible.
Used to emphasize or indicate a consequence.
A more formal equivalent of 和 (hé) or 跟 (gēn).
A more formal equivalent of 和 (hé) or 跟 (gēn).
A common biblical term for any living being.
Introduces a passive or relative clause (that which is...).
Classical Chinese possessive particle, similar to 的 (de).
Often implies eternity or for all time in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 我把天虹放在雲彩中，作我與大地立約的記號。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
Functions as a locative suffix here.
A more formal equivalent of 和 (hé) or 跟 (gēn).

verses.text: 我使雲彩遮蓋大地時，彩虹出現雲彩中，

words.note: A causative verb, meaning 'to cause something to happen'.
Acts as a temporal marker suffix, indicating 'when' something occurs.
Functions as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 我就記念我與你們和一切有生命的活物所立的約：水不再成為洪水，來毀滅凡有生命的。

words.note: Indicates a consequence or immediate succession.
Can imply remembering and acting upon, not just recall.
A more formal equivalent of 和 (hé) or 跟 (gēn).
A common biblical term for any living being.
Introduces a passive or relative clause (that which is...).
Often used in formal or biblical contexts to mean 'whatever' or 'all who'.

verses.text: 彩虹在雲彩中出現，我看見了就記念我與地上一切有生命的活物，所立的永約。」

words.note: Often used with 在... (zài...) to mean 'in' or 'among'.
Indicates completion of an action or change of state.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb, often indicating the object or agent.

verses.text: 神對挪亞說：「這就是我與地上凡有生命的立約的記號。」
挪亞的兒子，從方舟裡出來的，就是閃、含、雅弗；含是迦南的父親。

words.note: 方舟 is a specific term for Noah's Ark.

verses.heading: The Curse of Canaan

verses.text: 這三個人是挪亞的兒子，全地的人都是從這些人播散開來的。

words.note: Used as a resultative complement indicating spreading or beginning.
Used here to emphasize the manner or source of an action, similar to 'it was from...that'.

verses.text: 挪亞作起農夫來，栽種葡萄園。

words.note: Used with 來 (lái) to indicate the beginning of an action or state.
Used with 起 (qǐ) to indicate the beginning of an action or state.

verses.text: 他喝酒，喝醉了，就在帳棚裡光著身子。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'tent' or 'tabernacle'.

verses.text: 迦南的父親含看見了自己父親的下體，就去告訴在外面的兩個兄弟。

words.note: Refers to the genitals or lower body, often used euphemistically in older texts.

verses.text: 於是，閃和雅弗二人拿了件外衣，搭在自己的肩膀上，倒退著進去，蓋上他們父親的下體；因為他們背著臉，所以沒有看見他們父親的下體。

words.definition: to drape over, to put on

words.note: Refers to the genitals or lower body, often used euphemistically in older texts.
Means to have one's back to someone or something, turning the face away.
Refers to the genitals or lower body, often used euphemistically in older texts.

verses.text: 挪亞酒醒以後，知道小兒子對他所作的事，

words.note: A grammatical particle indicating a passive or nominalized action.

verses.text: 就說：「迦南應當受咒詛，他必給自己的兄弟，作奴僕的奴僕。」

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
More formal or archaic than 奴隸 (núlì) for 'slave'.
More formal or archaic than 奴隸 (núlì) for 'slave'.

verses.text: 又說：「耶和華，閃的 神，是應當稱頌的；願迦南作他的奴僕。

words.note: The leading space often indicates the proper name for God in CUV.
Often used for praising God.
Refers to Shem.

verses.text: 願 神使雅弗擴展，使雅弗住在閃的帳棚裡；願迦南作他的奴僕。」

words.note: Refers to Shem.

verses.text: 洪水以後，挪亞又活了三百五十年。

words.note: Refers to the Genesis flood.

verses.text: 挪亞共活了九百五十歲，就死了。
